constituent: grace, cause, pent in, large, St. Bernard, heart
heisigStory: Take grace in its sense of a favor freely bestowed, not in its meaning of charming manners or fluid movement. The primitives: cause . . . heart.
koohiiStory1: Grace here is a favor freely bestowed, like a good deed. So to remember this kanji, go to the local shelter, find a big dog pent up in a small cage and adopt him. That will cause a warm feeling in your heart!
koohiiStory2: This kanji tells us that wherever heart is the cause, grace is the consequence. Think of “grace” as a graceful act: something benevolent that comes from the heart.
myStory: tốt bụng. tử tế. nguyên nhân con tim làm tốt bụng
